subject: PE Today: Eye on iPhone
body:
CBSNews.com













Public Eye Chat With ... George Osterkamp"If I were Apple, I would be thrilled at 
      the coverage so far. I think it's been masterfully handled by Apple. The 
      phones have not been available to use, or to experiment with, so a large 
      part of the coverage has been about what Apple says the phone will 
      do.  And those things sounds 
      great. The coverage may not be so good in the future if the phones don't 
      work."[+ Read More]


"Gotcha" 
      Without a "Get"A tempest in the sweltering DC teapot 
      has developed this past week with regards to an investigative report in 
      the upcoming issue of Harper’s. Washington Editor Ken 
      Silverstein pretended to be an executive with ties to Turkmenistan 
      looking for good PR for the country, and went hunting for a lobbying firm 
      willing to do so -- and then wrote up what he had discovered under false 
      pretenses.  But was the end result worth all the 
      subterfuge?[+ Read More]



FAIR 
      vs. Greenfield, cont.
This week's campaign by the 
      people at Fairness and Accuracy in Reporting (FAIR) against CBS chief 
      political correspondent Jeff Greenfield 
      has demonstrated a core truth: that the drumbeat of 
      media criticism from all quarters continues to create 
      an appetite that mere acknowledgement and engagement cannot 
      sate.[+ Read More]
